snippet: Jiang Jiemin is the first full member of the elite Central Committee to be publicly singled out on corruption charges under the country’s leader, Xi Jinping.
abstract: Chinese Communist Party announces that Jiang Jiemin, senior official responsible for overseeing state-owned corporations, is under investigation for graft in what appears to be part of larger corruption inquiry into Zhou Yongkang, retired chief of China's domestic security apparatus; investigation represent boldest efforts yet by China's top leader, Xi Jinping to consolidate his authority and extinguish Zhou's lingering influence.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and JONATHAN ANSFIELD
byline.contributor: Chris Buckley reported from Hong Kong, and Jonathan Ansfield from Beijing. Edward Wong contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Jiang Jiemin is the first full member of the elite Central Committee to be publicly singled out on corruption charges under the country’s leader, Xi Jinping.

headline.main: Senior Chinese Official Falls Under Scrutiny as Some Point to Larger Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Senior Chinese Official Falls Under Scrutiny as Some Point to Larger Inquiry

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
keywords.name: organizations
